content: Today,I brought to us how we can secure profit while trading, many of us might have heard or known this but for the sake of those who are unaware you can secure your  profit while trading once you are already in profit by placing your SL above your market entry.Not everybody are into trading in this our local board but for the sake traders in the house. In my explanation,  I will be using meta trader as I'm used to it and I place my trade mostly on it.How is this done?? I'm going to explain this step by step The First approach is to Analyse your market very well with full effort to attain a profit when trade is being placed and make sure you have your TP and SL well placed because of other outcomes.Example one of my placed trade with only SL actually.Once you are already  in profit you can make use of the tool provided  to check for where you want your profit to be secured and you can calculate that according to the pips and your lots size.Once done with the calculations, you can now shift your SL to the point you've calculated, however when the SL is being breached it will be triggered as profit.with this you now have a profit securerNote: While securing your profit  you might want to consider  a possible  retest from the market once hit your trade will be automatically closed unless  you have already attain your exact profit then,you can follow the market with your SL and you can do and undo this as many times as you want. Abbr:SL -Stop lossTP - Take profitEdited :  to only English.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: In crypto trading (on exchanges), there is nothing called pips or lots, both are used in forest trading.I have been in trading for over three years. My advice for anyone is to trade with the amount of money that they can afford to lose. Trading is different and require skills, but it can be similar to gambling if comparing it with with losses.

comments.author: Bitco55
comments.body: Yeah, but OP you probably would have specified the type of trading... I was a little bit confused at first with the terms. Anyways, thanks for the information though, but just for knowledge's sake, I wanted to ask; Are pips and lots like currency and assets, respectively, to be liquidated?

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: Quote from: Bitco55 on September 25, 2023, 12:43:35 PM Are pips and lots like currency and assets, respectively, to be liquidated?Firstly,  PIP(price interest point ) is a unit used as measurement for change in value of  currency exchange. So you are right I'm talking about fiat currency. Usually  it's always in a small unit of 1/10⁴. So when you make a  price change of example GBP/USD  moves from 1.2003 to 1.2004  that's  one pip . Lot size is the specific amouts you are willing to set you trade, so you profit and loss moves accordingto your lot size.Now  coming back to wether your currency or asset could get liquidated,Currency don't get liquidated in forex but you monetary asset which can be  a digital fiat or converted currency  placed  for trading or set for trading could get liquidated if you place a trade and you are running a loss which cannot meet up with your current fund deposited . This is mostly set according to brokers' to prevent them from running loss  from your trade, some broker might leave you little funds out of your deposit from the liquidation. You can however  prevent this by placing SL and TP as have saidAccount leveraging/ funds leveraging :some brokers allow distinct account between deposits and trading funds so you can withdraw from deposits into trading funds little by little  aslo you can do the vice - versa by withdrawing profits into the  deposit account.[/list]
